segment.source: The App-V Sequencer has detected a directory that contains 64-bit and 32-bit executables and/or dynamic-link library (.dll) files that depend on the same side-by-side assembly.
segment.target: The App-V Sequencer has detected a directory that contains 64-bit and 32-bit executables and/or dynamic-link library (.dll) files that depend on the same side-by-side assembly.

segment.source: Typically, the Sequencer creates private side-by-side assemblies for all public assemblies that are used by the package; however, it is not possible to create 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the private assemblies in the same directory.
segment.target: Typically, the Sequencer creates private side-by-side assemblies for all public assemblies that are used by the package; however, it is not possible to create 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the private assemblies in the same directory.

segment.source: If the Sequencer detects a single conflict, it will perform the following actions:
segment.target: If the Sequencer detects a single conflict, it will perform the following actions:

segment.source: Remove all of the existing 64-bit private assemblies in the entire package, whether or not the directory has a conflict.
segment.target: Remove all of the existing 64-bit private assemblies in the entire package, whether or not the directory has a conflict.

segment.source: Create only 32-bit versions of the private side-by-side assemblies.
segment.target: Create only 32-bit versions of the private side-by-side assemblies.

segment.source: You should natively install public versions of all the required 64-bit assemblies on the computer running the Sequencer and on all App-V client computers.
segment.target: You should natively install public versions of all the required 64-bit assemblies on the computer running the Sequencer and on all App-V client computers.

segment.source: To locate the required existing public assemblies, open the directory where the package is saved and look in the VFS folder.
segment.target: To locate the required existing public assemblies, open the directory where the package is saved and look in the VFS folder.

segment.source: For example, if the package root is Q:MyApp, when you sequence the application, look in Q:MyAppVFSCSIDLWindowsWinSxSManifests and locate all of the existing public assemblies.
segment.target: For example, if the package root is Q:MyApp, when you sequence the application, look in Q:MyAppVFSCSIDLWindowsWinSxSManifests and locate all of the existing public assemblies.

segment.source: The 64-bit versions of these files will always start with the following text at the beginning of the manifest name: amd64….
segment.target: The 64-bit versions of these files will always start with the following text at the beginning of the manifest name: amd64….

segment.source: The exact name and version of the assembly can be found in the associated manifest file.
segment.target: The exact name and version of the assembly can be found in the associated manifest file.

segment.source: Use any of the following links to download and install the correct version of the required prerequisites:
segment.target: Use any of the following links to download and install the correct version of the required prerequisites:

segment.source: Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x64)
segment.target: Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 SP1 Redistributable Package (x64)

segment.source: Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1 Redistributable Package (x64)
segment.target: Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 SP1 Redistributable Package (x64)
